block.p: Julie Ellyn Strauss-Gabel, the daughter of Neila and Ron Gabel of White Plains, was married last evening to David Matthew Feldman, the son of Gloria and Michael Feldman of Great Neck, N.Y. Rabbi David Posner officiated at the Millennium Broadway Hotel in New York.
The bride and bridegroom graduated from Amherst College, she cum laude and he magna cum laude. They met there as arts editors of The Amherst Student, the college newspaper.

Julie Ellyn Strauss-Gabel, the daughter of Neila and Ron Gabel of White Plains, was married last evening to David Matthew Feldman, the son of Gloria and Michael Feldman of Great Neck, N.Y. Rabbi David Posner officiated at the Millennium Broadway Hotel in New York.
The bride and bridegroom graduated from Amherst College, she cum laude and he magna cum laude. They met there as arts editors of The Amherst Student, the college newspaper.

The bride, 28, incorporated her mother's maiden name into her surname and will continue to be known as Ms. Strauss-Gable. She received a master's degree in education from Harvard and is an associate editor at Clarion Books, a children's imprint of Houghton-Mifflin in New York. Her father is a freelance forensic photographer, in White Plains. Her mother teaches home economics at the White Plains Middle School.

The bridegroom, 27, is a writer and puppeteer for children's theater and television. His mother is an interior designer in Great Neck. His father is a senior partner in Proskauer Rose, the New York law firm.
